Giant Weasel.name: Giant Weasel
traits: Keen Hearing and Smell. The weasel has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

Giant Rat.name: Giant Rat
traits: Keen Smell. The rat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.
Pack Tactics. The rat has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the rat’s allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

Badger.name: Badger
traits: Keen Smell. The badger has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

Boar.name: Boar
traits: Charge. If the boar moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a tusk attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 3 (1d6) slashing damage and must succeed on a DC 11 Strength save or be knocked prone.
Relentless. If the boar takes 7 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

Panther.name: Panther
traits: Keen Smell. The panther has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

Pounce. If the panther moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 12 Strength save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the panther can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

Giant Badger.name: Giant Badger
traits: Keen Smell. The badger has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

Dire Wolf.name: Dire Wolf
traits: Keen Hearing and Smell. The wolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.
Pack Tactics. The wolf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wolf’s allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

actions.name: Bite
actions.extra: If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

Giant Elk.name: Giant Elk
traits: Charge. If the elk moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage and must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.
Giant Elk.languages: Understands Common, Elvish, and Sylvan but can’t speak them
